content:
• Tuesday, September 25, 2012
  • CPRT

    Copart (NASDAQ:CPRT): FQ4 EPS of $0.35 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $226.6M beats by $5M. Shares...

    Copart (NASDAQ:CPRT): FQ4 EPS of $0.35 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $226.6M beats by $5M. Shares -2.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:52 PM
  • IDCC

    Some more S&P MidCap 400 changes: InterDigital (NASDAQ:IDCC) will replace Quest Software...

    Some more S&P MidCap 400 changes: InterDigital (NASDAQ:IDCC) will replace Quest Software (NASDAQ:QSFT) as of the Sep. 28 close, and Genesee & Wyoming (NYSE:GWR) will replace Collective Brands (NYSE:PSS) as of the Oct. 1 close. Quest shareholders just approved the company's $28/share acquisition by Dell. IDCC +3.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:06 PM
  • ANRZQ

    Kraft Foods (KRFTV) is replacing struggling Alpha Natural (ANR) in the S&P 500 as of the...

    Kraft Foods (KRFTV) is replacing struggling Alpha Natural (ANR) in the S&P 500 as of the Oct. 1 close. Alpha will be added to the S&P MidCap 400, where it will replace Korn/Ferry (NYSE:KFY). KFT +1% AH. ANR -2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM | 4 Comments
  • SCMP

    Sucampo Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SCMP) and Takeda Pharmaceuticals (TKPYY.PK) say the FDA,has...

    Sucampo Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SCMP) and Takeda Pharmaceuticals (TKPYY.PK) say the FDA,has granted priority review of their supplemental new drug application for an additional indication for Amitiza, a treatment for opioid-induced constipation in patients with chronic, non-cancer pain. A decision is expected by late January 2013. Shares +7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM
  • SUNEQ

    MEMC (WFR -4.7%) rises 2.8% AH, winning back some of the day's losses, after announcing it has...

    MEMC (WFR -4.7%) rises 2.8% AH, winning back some of the day's losses, after announcing it has terminated a 10--year solar wafer supply agreement with Germany's Conergy. The agreement, signed in '07, featured pre-set prices. Since then, wafer prices have crashed, something MEMC says "created challenges" for the Conergy deal. MEMC will receive a $21.2M payoff as part of the termination, and will take over Conergy's operations/maintenance contracts for solar power plants.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM
  • GNW

    Genworth Financial (GNW -6.8%) finished the day as the S&P 500's worst performer, apparently...

    Genworth Financial (GNW -6.8%) finished the day as the S&P 500's worst performer, apparently weighed by Philly Fed's Charles Plosser's view that short-term rates may need to be raised "well before" the mid-2015 target. GNW already has the dubious distinction of being one of the lowest-rated stocks in the insurance industry. Investors also are wary of a potential Moody's downgrade.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM
  • STP

    European solar firms have filed another complaint with the EC accusing their Chinese rivals of...

    European solar firms have filed another complaint with the EC accusing their Chinese rivals of benefiting from illegal subsidies. Germany's SolarWorld claims the subsidies amount to 20x Chinese consumption and 2x global demand. The complaint comes a day the China Development Bank renewed its pledge to support 12 local vendors, including Suntech (STP -8.9%), Trina (TSL +1.8%), and Yingli (YGE +2.4%). (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 4 Comments
  • TSLA

    Tumbling Tesla Motors (TSLA -9.6%) triggered Nasdaq's short-sale circuit breakers after...

    Tumbling Tesla Motors (TSLA -9.6%) triggered Nasdaq's short-sale circuit breakers after investors dumped shares following the electric car maker's reduction of its 2012 sales target and news of a secondary offering of 4.34M common shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM | 8 Comments
  • ATGE

    For-profit education stocks are broadly lower: DeVry (DV -3.8%) is getting the boot from the...

    For-profit education stocks are broadly lower: DeVry (DV -3.8%) is getting the boot from the S&P 500, ITT Educational Services (ESI-OLD -6.4%) reportedly is in contact with the SEC regarding disclosures in filings, and Bridgeport Education (BPI -6.2%) says ~450 positions focused on admissions at Ashford University have been eliminated.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM | 1 Comment
  • AXE

    Anixter International (AXE -7.8%), which distributes wiring systems, networking products and...

    Anixter International (AXE -7.8%), which distributes wiring systems, networking products and fasteners, slips after being cut to Underperform by Credit Suisse. The firm cites softness in datacom spending and a European industrial production slowdown.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM
  • NUS

    Nu Skin (NUS -1.7%) spikes lower on rumors that it could lose its Chinese license. Citron...

    Nu Skin (NUS -1.7%) spikes lower on rumors that it could lose its Chinese license. Citron Research notes that if the rumors are true, it would also be bad for for USANA (USNA -3.7%) who has as many if not more "China issues" than NUS.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -5.5%) moves lower after a $50 rebate on Keurig brewers...

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -5.5%) moves lower after a $50 rebate on Keurig brewers catches the eyes of traders. Though it's not the first company in the world to move products with a discount, the timing from GMCR comes at the end of its quarter with competitive pressure from a host of companies already unsettling investors.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM | 5 Comments
  • AMD

    AMD (AMD -4.6%), no stranger to bearish Street commentary, is getting hit today by a critical...

    AMD (AMD -4.6%), no stranger to bearish Street commentary, is getting hit today by a critical report from FBR's Craig Berger. Berger lowered his target on the chipmaker to $6 from $7.50 while airing the usual assortment of concerns related to PC demand (macro, back-to-school weakness, tablets/smartphones, Windows 8 anticipation, etc.). (yesterday)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • RHT

    Some enterprise software stocks are posting moderate declines following Red Hat's (RHT -3.5%)...

    Some enterprise software stocks are posting moderate declines following Red Hat's (RHT -3.5%) FQ2 results and guidance. ORCL -2.2%. CTXS -1.7%. QLIK -2.3%. During its earnings call, Red Hat blamed its slightly weak guidance on slow growth for its training/services business. That could have some Oracle investors on edge, given the company's heavy dependence on license update and services revenue. Red Hat also boasted it renewed all of its 25 biggest deals up for renewal.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM
  • JOY

    A Joy Global (JOY -3.8%) executive at the MINExpo comments that the recent GE (GE +0.6%)...

    A Joy Global (JOY -3.8%) executive at the MINExpo comments that the recent GE (GE +0.6%) acquisitions are interesting, in that they are small and niche players. It may be a "toe in the water" move by the company. Just yesterday, talk circulated in the market that GE may be looking at JOY as it's next target.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM | 4 Comments
  • CAT

    Heavy equipment makers lag the broader market after Caterpillar (CAT -3.2%) lowered its 2015...

    Heavy equipment makers lag the broader market after Caterpillar (CAT -3.2%) lowered its 2015 guidance due to slumping demand for mining equipment as well as a sluggish global economic recovery. CAT's cautious forecast is infecting other stocks that also depend on countries like China to keep building homes and factories: JOY -4%, TEX -4.2%, MTW -5.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM | 4 Comments
  • PLCM

    Polycom (PLCM -4.2%) slumps following news China's Huawei is planning a major push into the...

    Polycom (PLCM -4.2%) slumps following news China's Huawei is planning a major push into the high-margin telepresence videoconferencing market, with the goal of overtaking Cisco (NASDAQ:CSCO) as the market's #1 vendor. Polycom and Cisco are already struggling with poor demand for their videoconferencing gear, partly due to competition from software-based solutions, and Huawei, known for aggressively undercutting Western rivals, could pressure both the companies' sales and margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN -7.4%) paid $15M-$20M to acquire restaurant reservations/discounts platform...

    Groupon (GRPN -7.4%) paid $15M-$20M to acquire restaurant reservations/discounts platform Savored, Fortune reports. Shares have tumbled below $5 today in the absence of major news, as recent consumer Internet IPOs remain under pressure. Zynga (ZNGA -4.4%) is also selling off.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM
  • RVLT

    Nexxus Lighting (NEXS +14.6%) says it's settled pending patent litigation brought against it by...

    Nexxus Lighting (NEXS +14.6%) says it's settled pending patent litigation brought against it by Royal Philips Electronics (PHG +0.6%). Philips will grant NEXS an ongoing, royalty-bearing license to its comprehensive portfolio of patented LED technologies under Philips' LED luminaire and retrofit bulb licensing program. NEXS will pay Philips a one-time, lump-sum royalty fee to settle past sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM
  • CGNX

    Cognex (CGNX -11.4%) plummets courtesy of a downgrade to Underweight from Piper, which says it's...

    Cognex (CGNX -11.4%) plummets courtesy of a downgrade to Underweight from Piper, which says it's "increasingly cautious" about the industrial machine vision system maker due to 3 months of declining PMI figures for the U.S. and China. The firm expects Cognex's "Greater China" sales to fall 15%-20% in 2012, and U.S. sales to fall 10%-15% in 2H from 1H levels.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • CSGS

    CSG Systems (CSGS -3.8%) slips after Citigroup cut the shares to Neutral/High Risk on valuation....

    CSG Systems (CSGS -3.8%) slips after Citigroup cut the shares to Neutral/High Risk on valuation. The firm notes the stock's strong run this year heading into potential contract renewals with key clients Comcast (NASDAQ:CMCSA) and Time Warner (NYSE:TWX) which it believes have been priced in. Additonally, a weak sales environment implies a lack of other catalysts while the need for continued investments implies margin weakness.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM
  • EA

    Game developers sell off following a report pay-TV providers are looking to offer...

    Game developers sell off following a report pay-TV providers are looking to offer console-quality cloud gaming services in 2013-2014. EA -3.5%. ATVI -2.3%. TTWO -1.4%. THQI -2.4%. If these services take off (a big if, given the challenges others have faced), they'd almost certainly rely on games from top developers. But there could also be more competition from social/casual games, and less favorable revenue splits.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM | 2 Comments
  • MM

    Millennial Media (MM -5.1%) heads south on lockup expiration day. SA author Valuable Insights...

    Millennial Media (MM -5.1%) heads south on lockup expiration day. SA author Valuable Insights recently noted 64.3M shares, or over 84% of Millennial's total outstanding shares, become eligible for sale today.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM +4.7%) rallies as CEO Thorsten Heins tries to rally the faithful at...

    Research In Motion (RIMM +4.7%) rallies as CEO Thorsten Heins tries to rally the faithful at RIM's developer conference. Heins promises carrier testing for BlackBerry 10 devices will begin next month (sales are due to begin in Q1), and shows off a feature called BlackBerry Hub, which aggregates e-mail, social networking content, and other time-sensitive data. He also claims RIM's subscriber base has risen by 2M in recent months to 80M (no doubt thanks to emerging markets) - analysts have been forecasting a decline. (live blog)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM | 25 Comments
  • P

    Pandora (P -2.5%) slips after Nomura's Brian Nowack starts coverage with a Reduce and $8.50...

    Pandora (P -2.5%) slips after Nomura's Brian Nowack starts coverage with a Reduce and $8.50 target. Oddly, Nowack expects Pandora to grow its share of U.S. Internet radio listening time to 89% in 2016 from a current 78% and last year's 64%, but is nonetheless worried about competition from more personalized services offering stronger social networking ties. Spotify, Slacker, and Clear Channel's iHeartRadio are named. (yesterday)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM
  • SWSH

    Shares of Swisher Hygiene (SWSH -17%) get flushed after the company says it notified the NASDAQ...

    Shares of Swisher Hygiene (SWSH -17%) get flushed after the company says it notified the NASDAQ that its Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2011 and Form 10-Qs for the quarterly periods ended March 31, 2012 and June 30, 2012 will not be filed with the SEC in time to meet the extended deadline it had previously been granted.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • FIO

    Fusion-io (FIO +2.9%) rallies after Wunderlich starts coverage with a Buy and $38 target. Like...

    Fusion-io (FIO +2.9%) rallies after Wunderlich starts coverage with a Buy and $38 target. Like others, the firm sees Fusion-io as a potential M&A target, even though its business model could pose challenges for an acquiring server OEM. Pac Crest launched coverage with a $38 target last week.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • KEG

    Key Energy Services (KEG -12.2%) plunges on this morning's downward guidance on Q3 revenues...

    Key Energy Services (KEG -12.2%) plunges on this morning's downward guidance on Q3 revenues based on declines in U.S. drilling and completion-related activity; prior expectations were for core oil market activity to be relatively flat in H2. Instead, drilling rig counts in these markets are down ~8% since the beginning of Q3, CEO Dick Alario says. Peers BAS -8% and SPN -6.7% also lower.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • ASH

    Ashland (ASH -5.3%) shares tumble on weak August sales in its specialty chemicals segment,...

    Ashland (ASH -5.3%) shares tumble on weak August sales in its specialty chemicals segment, according to an SEC filing. The 9.7% drop marked the third month in a row of falling sales in the segment, though Y/Y sales were higher. The segment was the biggest contributor to total sales in ASH's FQ3.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM
  • AEZS

    Aeterna Zentaris (AEZS +2%) gains today after saying the European Patent Office has granted its...

    Aeterna Zentaris (AEZS +2%) gains today after saying the European Patent Office has granted its patent for the use of the ghrelin agonist, AEZS-130, which is related to methods and kits for use in diagnosis of growth hormone deficiency in humans and animals. The patent application was filed in 2007 under the title "Methods and Kits to Diagnose Growth Hormone Deficiency", and will expire in 2027. A similar patent has already been granted in the U.S.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM
  • PURE

    PURE Bioscience (OTC:PURE -4.3%) gives back an early morning pop and drifts lower after...

    PURE Bioscience (OTC:PURE -4.3%) gives back an early morning pop and drifts lower after announcing that it had regained compliance with Nasdaq listing requirements, and will continue to trade on the Nasdaq exchange.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM
  • ZAGG

    Shares of Zagg (ZAGG +1.4%) bounce around as SA author Worthless Pennies speculates that the...

    Shares of Zagg (ZAGG +1.4%) bounce around as SA author Worthless Pennies speculates that the company could be the target of a SEC probe. Thought it's only anecdotal evidence at best, a response by the SEC to a Freedom of Information Act request mirrors that of a company under investigation.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM | 5 Comments
  • DXI

    Dejour Energy (DEJ +13.9%) says the first well at its 72%-owned Kokopelli project in the...

    Dejour Energy (DEJ +13.9%) says the first well at its 72%-owned Kokopelli project in the Piceance Basin, Colo., drilled 8,440 ft. encountered formation quality and gas column thickness; the 2500 ft. of gross gas column, depth and composition of formations encountered were as expected. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM | 1 Comment
  • ATRS

    Antares Pharma (ATRS +11%) jumps after reporting positive results from its Actual Human Use...

    Antares Pharma (ATRS +11%) jumps after reporting positive results from its Actual Human Use study, to assess the effectiveness of self-administered Vibex Methotrexate for adult patients with rheumatoid arthritis. The company said that the results show that self-administration of the drug is safe and well tolerated. All 101 patients were able to self-administer the medication successfully following standardized training and review of written instructions.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM | 4 Comments
  • CDMO

    It may look good on paper, but the 60% upswing in Perigrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM +50%) this...

    It may look good on paper, but the 60% upswing in Perigrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM +50%) this morning is a paltry move compared to yesterdays 75% cratering the shares took after reporting that previously released results from a midstage cancer drug study aren't reliable because of a third-party error. The big relative move off the bottom is largely a "dead cat bounce" when you consider that it still remains down 67% from Friday's close.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM | 2 Comments
  • MTP

    Dara BioSciences (DARA +5.5%) pops after the company announced the completion of a series of...

    Dara BioSciences (DARA +5.5%) pops after the company announced the completion of a series of agreements with a number of specialty pharmacy providers, leading group purchasing organizations, retail partners, reimbursement experts, and a third-party logistics provider, which should significantly enhance its commercial scale and capabilities. Its distribution network now consists of more than 45K retail pharmacies, mail order pharmacies, and long-term care facilities.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • PAYX

    Paychex (PAYX -2.9%) shares sink as FQ1 revenues fall short of expectations amid difficulty...

    Paychex (PAYX -2.9%) shares sink as FQ1 revenues fall short of expectations amid difficulty attracting new business in the sluggish jobs market. Following the results, Citibank downgrades PAYX to Sell, noting it sees "limited near-term catalysts for the stock given our expectation for meager job growth and low interest rates."
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • VRTX

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX -2.3%) and partner Alios BioPharma say they've decided to...

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX -2.3%) and partner Alios BioPharma say they've decided to discontinue development of their hepatitis C virus drug candidate ALS-2158 due to disappointing results, but plan to begin Phase II testing of ALS-2200, an orally administered HCV drug regimen, by the end of the year. The companies hope to run one Phase II test of the drug in combination with Ribvarin, and a second testing with VRTX's recently approved HCV therapy Incivek.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM
  • Z

    Zillow plunges (Z -5.4%) after becoming Citron Research's latest target (.pdf). Zillow's...

    Zillow plunges (Z -5.4%) after becoming Citron Research's latest target (.pdf). Zillow's valuation (16.5x trailing sales) and insider sales receive scrutiny, as do its heavy sales/marketing expenses (44% of Q2 revenue) and slowing unique visitor growth. The short-seller also highlights a Citi survey indicating slowing online real estate ad spending growth among agents, and subdued enthusiasm for Zillow's Premier Agent service. Trulia (TRLA -3.2%) is also off.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • NBR

    Nabors Industries (NBR -3.8%) is downgraded to Neutral with a $16 target price (down from $17)...

    Nabors Industries (NBR -3.8%) is downgraded to Neutral with a $16 target price (down from $17) at Global Hunter to reflect lower estimates for the current quarter through 2013. The firm says activity across most business lines is tracking below its prior forecast and is unlikely to meet expectations given the current fundamental headwinds impacting its product lines.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM
  • TSLA

    Maxim is out with a defense on Tesla Motors (TSLA -6.9%), noting that it sees the company...

    Maxim is out with a defense on Tesla Motors (TSLA -6.9%), noting that it sees the company meeting its 2013 production goal of 20K vehicles despite today's hiccup. The firm remain a Tesla believer for the long run, keeping shares slotted at Buy with a lofty $50 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • VMC

    Vulcan Materials (VMC -1.8%) and Martin Marietta (MLM -1.2%) are downgraded to Hold from Buy at...

    Vulcan Materials (VMC -1.8%) and Martin Marietta (MLM -1.2%) are downgraded to Hold from Buy at Keybanc, which believes VMC should trade within a $34-$51 range and sees fair value for MLM at $70-$96. Despite the downgrades, the firm remains "incrementally constructive" around public infrastructure spending.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • AMPE

    Ampio Pharmaceuticals (AMPE +5%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Buy at Aegis Capital. The firm...

    Ampio Pharmaceuticals (AMPE +5%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Buy at Aegis Capital. The firm calls it "one of the most underrated companies in the healthcare sector," with a "disciplined, capital-efficient approach" to developing drugs.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM
  • RVBD

    Riverbed (RVBD +3.7%) pops after William Blair upgrades shares to Outperform: the firm says...

    Riverbed (RVBD +3.7%) pops after William Blair upgrades shares to Outperform: the firm says checks indicate growing demand for Riverbed's new Granite systems, which improve storage performance for remote offices, as well as good visibility for government deals (a recent trouble spot) . Riverbed has steadily rallied since bottoming in July.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM
  • BKS

    Enthusiasm over Barnes & Noble's (BKS +3.7%) new Nook streaming service helps shares break out...

    Enthusiasm over Barnes & Noble's (BKS +3.7%) new Nook streaming service helps shares break out of a narrow trading range to reach monthly highs. Though the initiative will clearly help Nook products try to keep pace with Amazon's line of Kindles, Forrester Research analyst James McQuivey says that in the end the company will have to "sell everything" with their devices to stay in the game.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM
  • TIVO

    TiVo (TIVO +3.1%) rallies on an upgrade to Buy from Lazard: the firm thinks TiVo's settlement...

    TiVo (TIVO +3.1%) rallies on an upgrade to Buy from Lazard: the firm thinks TiVo's settlement with Verizon raises the odds of a deal with a Motorola Mobility, which probably would be more lucrative. Also, Jefferies is reiterating a Buy, arguing (like Janney) that the Verizon deal raises the odds of favorable outcomes in TiVo's other legal battles.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM
  • RSH

    Shares of RadioShack (RSH -9.3%) open lower with reports out that the retailer was only given a...

    Shares of RadioShack (RSH -9.3%) open lower with reports out that the retailer was only given a limited supply of iPhones from Apple that didn't even match the number of pre-orders it took down. Also contributing to the negative sentiment on the name is a stinging boot from the S&P MidCap 400 Index.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM
  • CMO

    Capstead Mortgage (CMO -1.2%) is downgraded to Neutral at Macquarie, which clearly is no longer...

    Capstead Mortgage (CMO -1.2%) is downgraded to Neutral at Macquarie, which clearly is no longer a fan of the sector, having recently downgraded Annaly and American Capital Agency as well. Capstead differs from those 2 giants in that the majority of its MBS portfolio consists of variable-rate paper.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:40 AM
  • OMEX

    Odyssey Marine Exploration (OMEX -24.9%) shares plunge on news its Gairsoppa and Mantola...

    Odyssey Marine Exploration (OMEX -24.9%) shares plunge on news its Gairsoppa and Mantola shipwreck recovery projects in the Atlantic Ocean will be deferred until Q2 2013, citing current weather conditions and a previous commitment to another charter.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:38 AM
  • DECK

    Shares of Deckers Outdoor (NASDAQ:DECK) fall 3.9% premarket after another report emerges tipping...

    Shares of Deckers Outdoor (NASDAQ:DECK) fall 3.9% premarket after another report emerges tipping off that sales of Ugg boots are weak. Sterne Agee notes distribution is "getting ugly" as the once red-hot boots are now ending up at formerly unacceptable retail chains.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM | 1 Comment
  • EPD

    Enterprise Products Partners (NYSE:EPD) -2.8% premarket after announcing a public offering of 8M...

    Enterprise Products Partners (NYSE:EPD) -2.8% premarket after announcing a public offering of 8M common units representing limited partner interests at $53.07/unit. The oil and gas pipeline operator plans to use net proceeds to reduce borrowings and for general partnership purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM | 5 Comments
  • CCL

    Carnival (NYSE:CCL): FQ3 EPS of $1.53 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $4.7B (+7.8% Y/Y) in-line....

    Carnival (NYSE:CCL): FQ3 EPS of $1.53 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $4.7B (+7.8% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +3.5% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:21 AM
  • BKS

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (NYSE:BKS) trade 2.9% higher premarket after the company sticks its toe...

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (NYSE:BKS) trade 2.9% higher premarket after the company sticks its toe into the streaming pool. The plan from the company includes the ability for customers to view Nook Video content purchased on non-Nook devices using digital rights stored in the cloud. It also appears that Nook Video will include content from HBO and Starz, as well as integrate with UltraViolet to give customers access to their physical and Blu-ray movies.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM
  • GENE

    Premarket gainers: GENE +14%. DARA +13%. PPHM +8%. ATRS +8%. OTC:PURE +6%. UDRL +6%. ROSG-OLD...

    Premarket gainers: GENE +14%. DARA +13%. PPHM +8%. ATRS +8%. OTC:PURE +6%. UDRL +6%. ROSG-OLD +6%.
    Losers: GEVO -16%. TSLA -8%. KEG -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • GENE

    Genetic Technologies (NASDAQ:GENE) +13.1% premarket after announcing its breast cancer treatment...

    Genetic Technologies (NASDAQ:GENE) +13.1% premarket after announcing its breast cancer treatment BREVAGen has been cleared for sale in Florida. The news follows approval of the drug for California in July. GENE says Florida and California combined represent 15%-20% of breast cancer incidence in the U.S.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • GEVO

    Gevo (NASDAQ:GEVO) -20.2% premarket on news the biofuels company will temporarily shift to...

    Gevo (NASDAQ:GEVO) -20.2% premarket on news the biofuels company will temporarily shift to ethanol at its Luverne, Minn., plant and stop producing isobutanol. Gevo doesn’t expect the Luverne plant to reach its desired year-end run rate until next year; it had said the plant would be producing ~1M/month before the end of 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:46 AM
  • EOX

    Emerald Oil (NYSEMKT:EOX) -7.3% premarket after announcing a public offering of 93.75M shares of...

    Emerald Oil (NYSEMKT:EOX) -7.3% premarket after announcing a public offering of 93.75M shares of its common stock to the public at $0.80/share.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:37 AM
  • SPLS

    Staples (NASDAQ:SPLS) announces a new strategic plan that will include reducing its retail...

    Staples (NASDAQ:SPLS) announces a new strategic plan that will include reducing its retail square footage space by 15% by the end of FY15 and enhancing its online business by integrating it directly with retail channels. Store closing in the U.S. and Europe will be accelerated as part of the trimming down. SPLS +1.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:34 AM | 1 Comment

    Union Drilling (NASDAQ:UDRL) agrees to be purchased by Sidewinder Drilling in an all-cash deal...

    Shares of Tesla Motors (NASDAQ:TSLA) fall 7.5% premarket after the company warns that Model S deliveries will be lower than anticipated. Though higher labor costs and manufacturing inefficiencies are cited as drags on Q3 margins with production slowed, Tesla says in Q4 margins will turn positive as cost efficiencies register with Model S volume back on track.
